audio_description: Assalamualaikum everyone, how are you all? I hope you all are doing well. Welcome to my channel. Today again I’ve brought a very amazing recipe for you. Today I am making Chicken Bombay Biryani with Shan’s Special Bombay Biryani Masala.

audio_description: It turns out very tangy, very spicy, and extremely delicious. I will share the entire procedure with you step-by-step. My recipe is a bit different from the one mentioned on the box. You can watch the video...

audio_description: For the biryani, first I will soak the rice for half an hour. I’ve taken good-quality basmati rice here, about half a kilogram. I’ll wash them properly and then soak for 30 minutes.

audio_description: Apart from that, the ingredients we’ll need include onions. I’ve taken three large-sized onions and finely sliced them. And we’ll need 3 tablespoons of ginger-garlic paste. I’ve also taken dry plums (alu bukhara)...

audio_description: I’ve taken half a cup of cooking oil. You’ll need Shan’s Bombay Biryani Masala – a little more than half a pack. I’ve taken a handful of mint leaves and some coriander. Take 4-5 green chilies too.

audio_description: I’m using two medium-sized potatoes – optional – if you like potatoes in your biryani, you can add them; otherwise, skip them. I’ve also taken half a kilogram of chicken and a bit of salt. Now first, in the pan...

audio_description: Don’t let the onions get too dark, otherwise, the gravy or korma will turn too dark in color. As soon as the onions are fried, I added the chicken, potatoes, and ginger-garlic paste. I added all these together, and now we’ll fry them.

audio_description: Perfectly fried chicken is golden on the outside but juicy and soft on the inside. The tip is: when frying chicken in oil, fry it covered at intervals – you can keep covering and uncovering it with a lid.

audio_description: Now again, I’m mixing it a little, and after mixing, I’ll cover it for 5–7 minutes so the tomatoes soften well. After that, we’ll sauté it (do the “bhunai”).

audio_description: The tomatoes softened nicely, and then I fried it for 3–4 more minutes. At this stage, I’ll remove all the cardamom. Cardamom doesn’t taste good when it comes into the mouth while eating biryani.

audio_description: Apart from that, I’ve added dry plums (alu bukhara). I love them in biryani. If you don’t, you can skip them or add tamarind instead. Now again we’ll add yogurt and dry plums...

audio_description: So I’ve added salt. I also added one stick of cinnamon, one teaspoon of white vinegar, and a handful of mint leaves. Then I waited for it to come to a boil. Once it started boiling, I added the rice.

audio_description: Now the next process is very simple – we’ll do the biryani layering. First, I added the masala in the pot, and then I added a layer of rice. On top of that goes the chicken layer. I’m doing a single layer here...

audio_description: Each grain of rice is separate and fluffy. The taste of this biryani is amazing – absolutely delicious. Just like the biryani you get at restaurants – tangy, spicy, and full of flavor – that’s how it turns out with Shan’s Special Bombay Biryani Masala.

audio_description: So this was my video for today. I hope you liked it. If you did, then like, share, and subscribe to my channel. And don’t forget to give the video a thumbs-up. InshaAllah, I’ll see you in the next video. Take good care of yourself and remember me in your prayers.
